definitions.definition: The chemical element with atomic number 78 and symbol Pt; a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, silverish-white transition metal of great value.
A whitish grey colour, like that of the metal.
A single or album that has achieved platinum sales, i.e. over 1 million or 2 million.

main_definition: The chemical element with atomic number 78 and symbol Pt; a dense, malleable, ductile, highly unreactive, silverish-white transition metal of great value.
secondary_definitions: A whitish grey colour, like that of the metal.
( music , countable ) A single or album that has achieved platinum sales, i.e. over 1 million or 2 million.
( medicine , countable , sometimes, elliptically ) A platinum-based drug: a platin .
